intro: Boechera dentata, commonly known as the toothed rockcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress species. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or arctic regions. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Boechera dentata is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
